noun.description: A remark made in order to anger, wound, or provoke someone.

verb.description: Provoke or challenge (someone) with insulting remarks.
examples: students began taunting her about her weight

origin: Early 16th century: from French tant pour tant like for like, tit for tat, from tant so much, from Latin tantum, neuter of tantus. An early use of the verb was exchange banter.
